answers.answer: I don't know that it does. There were some questions about cardiac risks and or clotting risks with avastin/lucentis, but I don't think it raises the BP.Best wishes,Timothy D. McGarity, Medical Doctor, Ophthalmologist

question: I have type 2  diabetes and am getting lucentis injections in both eyes for diabetic retinopathy.  Since getting them my blood pressure has skyrocketed.  From normal to 190's/100's.  No other medications have been added to my schedule for over a year.  I broke my knee several months ago and still have pain sometimes(not taking pain killers) and am not as active as I used to be which has caused me to gain 30 pounds.  Can pain raise blood pressure?  Is it the weight gain and lack of activity?  Is it the lucentis?  I don't want to stop taking it, it has improved my vision dramatically.  Thanks for any help.
title: Does lucentis raise blood pressure?
